questiontext.text:
A researcher administered a questionnaire to 175 randomly selected employees of a large company a questionnaire that mapped how they rated their supervisor. The scores ranged from 1 (very negative) to 10 (very positive). It tests whether people with permanent contracts [group 2; n=75] evaluate their supervisor differently than people with a temporary contract ______. It calculates the 95% confidence interval of the difference in averages, µ1 - µ2. This interval turns out to be µ[-0.04; 0.08] are.

Do the mean ratings of the two groups differ significantly from each other? And from what can this be inferred?

generalfeedback.text:
Language Dutch

Levels of Difficulty Easy

M&T Basics of quantitative research Basics of quantitative research

M&T BIS Default value

answer.text: Yes, because the number 0.05 lies within the interval.
No, because the number 0.00 lies within the interval.
Yes, because the number 0.00 lies within the interval.
No, because the number 0.05 lies within the interval.
